justification: In the abbreviation note the article specifies “EAT-26 = Eating Attitudes Test,” showing that the EAT-26 is the scale used to assess eating attitudes.
The same note lists “AAI = Appearance Anxiety Inventory,” indicating that appearance-related anxiety is measured with the Appearance Anxiety Inventory.
The article defines “EDDS = Eating Disorder Diagnostic Scale,” linking the EDDS to the assessment of eating-disorder symptomatology or diagnosis.
The abbreviation list states “EDE-Q = Eating Disorders Examination Questionnaire,” showing that this questionnaire is used to measure eating-disorder related constructs.
